sentences.english: He counted the creases of rucked leather wherein another's foot had nested warm.
sentences.chinese: 他数着皮面上的皱纹，这曾经是另一个人暖脚的窝。

sentences.english: A fault line of anger and distrust crossed his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒和怀疑在他额头上刻下了皱纹。

sentences.english: Tyler never ate in restaurants, and Marla wasn't wrinkled.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒从来不在餐馆里吃饭，而马拉也没有长皱纹。

sentences.english: A survey in France has shown that women who tend to eat a lot of salt wrinkle more.
sentences.chinese: 法国的一项调查表明，女性吃盐吃多了容易长皱纹。

sentences.english: More gray hairs and wrinkles to be found. Etc.
sentences.chinese: 会长出更多的白发和皱纹。
有些纸被弄得起了皱纹。

sentences.english: The rugged face of the old sailor.
Men tend to notice these lines on the forehead since they usually sleep with the face pressed face down on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 那些喜欢趴着睡觉的男士，则会发现前额出现皱纹。

sentences.english: Every wrinkle and laugh line has been well-earned.
sentences.chinese: 每一个皱纹和笑纹都是富有代价的。

sentences.english: I explained that it was good for wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 我解释说这种面霜对皱纹有好处。

sentences.english: Wrinkles can also be reduced through blepharoplasty.
sentences.chinese: 皱纹也可以通过眼睑整容术减少。

sentences.english: The digestive system of 45 day-old abalone Haliotis discus hannai Ino is studied by histological method.
sentences.chinese: 以组织学方法研究了45日龄皱纹盘鲍的消化系统。

sentences.english: A furrow, ridge or crease on a normally smooth surface.
sentences.chinese: 正常的平滑的表面上出现的皱纹，或折痕。

sentences.english: His pale lined face and luxuriant flowing hair.
sentences.chinese: 他那苍白而布有皱纹的面孔和浓密而飘拂的头发。

sentences.english: This picture is very clear and brings out the wrinkles in her face.
sentences.chinese: 这张照片很清晰，把她脸上的皱纹都照了出来。

sentences.english: Will you get wrinkles if you sleep with eye makeup?
sentences.chinese: 如果带着眼妆睡觉，会长皱纹么？

definition: to age/to deteriorate with age/old and weak
puffiness under the eyes/bags under the eyes
